text: Riparia is an extinct town in Whitman County, in the U.S. state of Washington. The GNIS classifies it as a populated place. A post office called Riparia was in operation between 1882 and 1963. The community most likely took its name from a nearby riparian zone. ==References== Category:Ghost towns in Washington (state) Category:Geography of Whitman County, Washington
title: Riparia, Washington
